question: What mass of sodium hydroxide, in grams, would contain 40 grams of oxygen?
answer:
100
(Solution: NaOH = 40g × 1 mol O/16 × 1 mol NaOH/1 mol O × 40g NaOH/1 mol NaOH = 100g)
